Description: Hand-made jar of rough straw tempered pottery, tapering from the shoulder to a pointed base. The sides turn inwards to a raised external lip. Good condition.
Curator's comments: This vase is from Garstang’s excavations in the Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, but was not found within a grave and is marked only with F (for Fort) on the exterior. For publication of the surviving records of Garstang’s excavations see B. Adams, The Fort Cemetery at Hierakonpolis, London (1987). Like 66b in Petrie’s Corpus of Proto-dynastic pottery (1953).
Acquisition name: Donated by: Frederick George Hilton Price
